h3cDhcpSnoop.name: h3cDhcpSnoop
h3cDhcpSnoop.contactinfo: Platform Team Beijing Institute Huawei-3com Tech, Inc. Http:\\www.huawei-3com.com E-mail:support@huawei-3com.com
h3cDhcpSnoop.description: The private mib file includes the DHCP Snooping profile.

h3cDhcpSnoopTable.name: h3cDhcpSnoopTable
h3cDhcpSnoopTable.description: The table containing information of DHCP clients listened by DHCP snooping and it's enabled or disabled by setting h3cDhcpSnoopEnable node.

h3cDhcpSnoopEntry.name: h3cDhcpSnoopEntry
h3cDhcpSnoopEntry.description: An entry containing information of DHCP clients.

h3cDhcpSnoopClientIpAddressType.name: h3cDhcpSnoopClientIpAddressType
h3cDhcpSnoopClientIpAddressType.description: DHCP clients' IP addresses type (IPv4 or IPv6).

h3cDhcpSnoopClientIpAddress.name: h3cDhcpSnoopClientIpAddress
h3cDhcpSnoopClientIpAddress.description: DHCP clients' IP addresses collected by DHCP snooping.

h3cDhcpSnoopClientMacAddress.name: h3cDhcpSnoopClientMacAddress
h3cDhcpSnoopClientMacAddress.description: DHCP clients' MAC addresses collected by DHCP snooping.

h3cDhcpSnoopClientProperty.name: h3cDhcpSnoopClientProperty
h3cDhcpSnoopClientProperty.description: Method of getting IP addresses collected by DHCP snooping.

h3cDhcpSnoopClientUnitNum.name: h3cDhcpSnoopClientUnitNum
h3cDhcpSnoopClientUnitNum.description: IRF (Intelligent Resilient Fabric) unit number via whom the clients get their IP addresses. The value 0 means this device does not support IRF.

h3cDhcpSnoopTrustTable.name: h3cDhcpSnoopTrustTable
h3cDhcpSnoopTrustTable.description: A table is used to configure and monitor port trusted status.

h3cDhcpSnoopTrustEntry.name: h3cDhcpSnoopTrustEntry
h3cDhcpSnoopTrustEntry.description: An entry containing information about trusted status of ports.

h3cDhcpSnoopTrustStatus.name: h3cDhcpSnoopTrustStatus
h3cDhcpSnoopTrustStatus.description: Trusted status of current port which supports both get and set operation.

h3cDhcpSnoopVlanTable.name: h3cDhcpSnoopVlanTable
h3cDhcpSnoopVlanTable.description: A table is used to configure and monitor DHCP Snooping status of VLANs.

h3cDhcpSnoopVlanEnable.name: h3cDhcpSnoopVlanEnable
h3cDhcpSnoopVlanEnable.description: DHCP Snooping status of current VLAN.

h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerMac.name: h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerMac
h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerMac.description: MAC address of the spoofing server and it is derived from link-layer header of offer packet. If the offer packet is relayed by dhcp relay entity, it may be the MAC address of relay entity.

h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerIP.name: h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerIP
h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerIP.description: IP address of the spoofing server and it is derived from IP header of offer packet. A tricksy host may send offer packet use other host's address, so this address can not always be trust.

h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerDetected.name: h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerDetected
h3cDhcpSnoopSpoofServerDetected.description: To detect unauthorized DHCP servers on a network, the DHCP snooping device sends DHCP-DISCOVER messages through its downstream port (which is connected to the DHCP clients). If any response (DHCP-OFFER message) is received from the downstream port, an unauthorized DHCP server is considered present, and then the device sends a trap. With unauthorized DHCP server detection enabled, the interface sends a DHCP-DISCOVER message to detect unauthorized DHCP servers on the network. If this interface receives a DHCP-OFFER message, the DHCP server which sent it is considered unauthorized.
